column4: What I don't understand is, if Ubuntu can play that drumming thing when I go to log in, how come it can't play anything else?
Still no sound, even after removing all that Pulse Audio stuff.
try running alsamixer -c 0 and making sure everything is on
Everything is up. Still no sound. :P
so it works when you log in, but stops after that?
I just meant, that log-on noise comes through my headphones fine, but once I'm in Ubuntu itself, I can't get sound from anywhere.
mplayer no, but I installed VLC.
can you install mplayer? might be able to get some information from it
Is mplayer the same as Totem Movie Player?
no - the totem player uses gstreamer by default and there is also a xine version as well
Okay, so what did you want me to do in mplayer?
its available in the repository - just go into the synaptic package manager and search for mplayer
thats fine - its a commandline movie player, though you can get guis for it
I can play music through mplayer. :D
thats great to hear - go to system, preferences, sound and set everything to alsa and see if that works for you
Thanks for your help. :) Appears that the audio channel was "Analogue Front"... but I still can't seem to play anything in VLC.
